author: Antony Worrall Thompson
method: Preheat the oven to 190C/375F/Gas 5 and grease and flour two baking sheets.  Mix together the oats, flour, salt, bicarbonate of soda and mixed spice. Cream the margarine in a bowl and beat in the pear and apple spread/purée, a little at a time. Beat in the oat mixture.  Place walnut sized portions of the mixture on a baking sheet, leaving a space of about 5cm/2in round each one. Flatten them slightly, with a fork. Bake the biscuits for 15 minutes or until they are beginning to turn golden. Leave the biscuits on the baking trays until they are cool and firm.
ingredients: 50g/2oz porridge oats,  75g/3oz wholemeal flour, plus a little extra,  pinch fine sea salt,  ½ tsp bicarbonate of soda,  ½ tsp ground mixed spice,  75g/3oz baking spread, plus extra for greasing,  50g/2oz pear or apple spread/purée
